hi guys: can anybody helps me with my modem device
Noramally linux distros doesn't contain modem drivers by default.
Search for driver on creative's site.
If you are refering to the CD you got with modem, it most probably contains windows only driver. Still see if you can find anything on it?
I suppose there isn't any creative driver available. There is high probability that your modem is based on some third party chipset. If you can find out which then it is easy to find driver.
: what do u advise me to do
There are some scripts available on net that can identify your chipset of modem. Search for them. Then search for the driver according to chippset.
Doenload this script. Uncompress it & run it. http://linmodems.technion.ac.il/packages/scanModem.gz
It will tell you the chipset of your modem.
You should then probably look into this site http://linmodems.technion.ac.il/
